Curator's comments: Bouquets of flowers are a feature of elite burial assemblages, such as at Thebes. Examples have been found laid on coffins, directly on the mummy, or left elsewhere within the tomb in the intact burials of the 17th and 18th dynasties analysed by Smith, MDAIK 48 (1992): 204.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
